data.title: 1and1 Vs SiteGround
data.meta_description: Are you searching for the perfect hosting company? I will compare 1and1 Vs SiteGround, two well-respected, popular, and old web hosting services.
data.text:
Are you searching for the perfect hosting company? I will compare 1and1 Vs SiteGround, two well-respected, popular, and old web hosting services.

Both platforms have been hosting sites for over 10 years. In this review, I will compare the features, speed, support, uptime, and more.

I will even help you setup your site today with a quick setup guide below.

Quick intro

1&1 Internet was founded in 1988 and it is a hosting company owned by United Internet. 1&1 is one of the oldest and largest web hosting companies in the world.

SiteGround was founded in 2004 by university students. What started out as a small business eventually turned into a leading web hosting service provider with over 400 employees.

Control panel

I’m not fond of 1&1’s custom control panel. I found that it is trickier to use and you don’t get the same number of features that you are getting with a cPanel control panel. If you don’t know what cPanel is, it is the hosting industries most popular control panel.

It is the easiest control panel to use and highly recommend for believers. Most likely if you are coming from another company, you have used it before. SiteGround and all the top hosting companies use cPanel which means SiteGround is going to be easier to set up and manage.

Check out SiteGround.

Domain

You will be happy to know that both hosting platforms give you a free domain when you select your hosting package. Free domains make setting up easier and they save you extra money as well.

Uptime comparison

It is crucial that you choose a company with a good uptime rating. Statistics show that website downtime can end up costing your business as much as $5,600 per minute.

If your site is down your reader or customer can end up becoming someone else’s reader or customer. Both hosting services are known for their high uptime. SiteGround offers a 99.99% uptime rating while 1&1 offers a 99.95% monthly uptime rating.

Data centers

1&1 has data centers located in Europe and in Lenexa, Kansas.

SiteGround has data centers in many different locations such as Chicago, USA, London, UK, Amsterdam, Netherlands, Singapore.

Speed comparison

Kissmetrics.com offers a great infographic on how your load speed matters. Every second counts. If I can’t access a website fast enough, then I’ll leave and go to another website. If you’re anything like me, then from experience you know it is essential to have a site that loads fast. Not only is it essential for customers, but Google uses site speed as a way to rank sites in the search engines.

1&1 offers one of the slowest loading times in the industry. 1&1 offers a load response time of around 700ms which is nowhere near the top hosts. SiteGround offers a load response time of around 300ms which makes it over 100% faster than 1&1. From years of observation I found that SiteGround offers the fasting loading times in the industry.

Start SiteGround at 60% off.

Price comparison

There is no denying that both companies offer web hosting for an awesome price. 1&1 is slightly cheaper. With their 12 month plan you are able to receive hosting for $0.99/month, which is one of the cheapest prices in the industry.

SiteGround offers premium hosting for $3.95/mo. Although SG is cheap 1&1 is slightly cheaper.

Hosting features comparison

SiteGround features

NGINX web server technology to speed up loading times.

SiteGround offers servers on three continents.

LXC-based stability

Geeky SuperCacher

High level electricity redundancy.

Anti-Hack Systems & Help

Free Cloudflare CDN

PHP7 and HHVM

HTTP/2 Enabled Servers

Free Let’s Encrypt SSLs

Free Daily Backup

cPanel & SSH Access

Free Website Builder

Multiple PHP Versions (7.0, 5.6, 5.5 and more)

1&1 features

Security with SSL Certificate

PHP 7 + OPcache

1&1 Hybrid Technology

Over 120 Click&Build and Web Apps

Webspace Recovery

Geo-redundancy

Up to 600 MB RAM

Multiple redundant 65 GBit/s connectivity

DDoS Protection

IPS/IDS & SIEM technology

Green energy

Support

Both support teams are identical. With both hosting providers, you will be given 24/7 web hosting support. Unlike some hosting companies, with 1&1 and SG you will be given phone support, chat support, guides, and more.

Short reviews from satisfied customers of each platform.

SG – servestudioshosting.com – Siteground rocks. Support is unbelievable. From the easiest of questions to the most difficult, the team always manages to help with the situation and make those of us on the other end feel honored (not stupid) while doing it. Your technology is terrific, but your customer service and support are beyond measure!

1&1 – queness.com – Great host. It has all the features that an average blogger like me wants. I have faced no problems yet. Their support is worth admiration. I have no programming skills, still running a stunning site. Thanks to 1&1 for their best support.

Which is better?

Both companies have their upsides, but I believe SiteGround easily tops 1&1 as the best web hosting provider in the industry. 1&1 is too slow for me to recommend it to others. SiteGround offers better uptime, better speed, it is easier to use, there are more dater center locations, and there are more features. I strongly recommend SG for your business and below I will help you to set up your site right now.

2. Choose your web hosting plan.

4. Complete the signup process.

4. Continue and allow the WP to complete the installation process.
